GRFILE.definition: Name of file containing grid specification (a)

ICFILE.definition: Name of file containing initial conditions, that is either a valid restart file or 'inicon.nc' if climatological based initial conditions are desired

MDV2HI.definition: Laplacian diffusion velocity for momentum dissipation (cm/s) (f)

MDV2LO.definition: Laplacian diffusion velocity for momentum dissipation (cm/s) (f)

MDV4HI.definition: Biharmonic diffusion velocity for momentum dissipation (cm/s) (f)

MDV4LO.definition: Biharmonic diffusion velocity for momentum dissipation (cm/s) (f)

CBAR.definition: rms flow speed for linear bottom friction law (cm/s) (f)

CB.definition: Nondiemnsional coefficient of quadratic bottom friction (f)

CWBDTS.definition: Coastal wave breaking damping resiprocal time scale (1/s) (f)

CWBDLS.definition: Coastal wave breaking damping length scale (m) (f)

MOMMTH.definition: Momentum equation discretization method. Valid methods: 'enscon' (Sadourny (1975) enstrophy conserving), 'enecon' (Sadourny (1975) energy conserving), 'enedis' (Sadourny (1975) energy conserving with some dissipation) (a)

EITMTH.definition: Eddy-induced transport parameterization method. Valid methods: 'intdif', 'gm' (a)

EDRITP.definition: Type of Richardson number used in eddy diffusivity computation. Valid types: 'shear', 'large scale' (a)

BMCMTH.definition: Baroclinic mass flux correction method. Valid methods: 'uc' (upstream column), 'dluc' (depth limited upstream column) (a)

RMPMTH.definition: Method of applying eddy-induced transport in the remap transport algorithm. Valid methods: 'eitvel', 'eitflx' (a)

EDWMTH.definition: Method to estimate eddy diffusivity weight as a function of the ration of Rossby radius of deformation to the horizontal grid spacing. Valid methods: 'smooth', 'step' (a)

MLRTTP.definition: Type of mixed layer restratification time scale. Valid types: 'variable', 'constant', 'limited' (a)

EDSPRS.definition: Apply eddy mixing suppression away from steering level (l)

EGC.definition: Parameter c in Eden and Greatbatch (2008) parameterization (f)

EGGAM.definition: Parameter gamma in E. & G. (2008) param. (f)

EGLSMN.definition: Minimum eddy length scale in  E. & G. (2008) param. (cm) (f)

EGMNDF.definition: Minimum diffusivity in E. & G. (2008) param. (cm**2/s) (f)

EGMXDF.definition: Maximum diffusivity in E. & G. (2008) param. (cm**2/s) (f)

EGIDFQ.definition: Factor relating the isopycnal diffusivity to the layer interface diffusivity in the Eden and Greatbatch (2008) parameterization. egidfq=difint/difiso () (f)

RI0.definition: Critical gradient richardson number for shear driven vertical mixing () (f)

RM0.definition: Efficiency factor of wind TKE generation in the Oberhuber (1993) TKE closure () (f)

RM5.definition: Efficiency factor of TKE generation by momentum entrainment in the Oberhuber (1993) TKE closure () (f)

CE.definition: Efficiency factor for the restratification by mixed layer eddies (Fox-Kemper et al., 2008) () (f)

BDMTYP.definition: Type of background diapycnal mixing. If bdmtyp=1 the background diffusivity is a constant divided by the Brunt-Vaisala frequency, if bdmtyp=2 the background diffusivity is constant () (i)

BDMC1.definition: Background diapycnal diffusivity times buoyancy frequency frequency (cm**2/s**2) (f)

TDFILE.definition: Name of file containing tidal wave energy dissipation divided by by bottom buoyancy frequency (a)

TKEPF.definition: Fraction of surface TKE that penetrates beneath mixed layer () (f)

NIWGF.definition: Global factor applied to the energy input by near-intertial motions () (f)

NIWBF.definition: Fraction of near-inertial energy dissipated in the boundary layer () (f)

NIWLF.definition: Fraction of near-inertial energy dissipated locally beneath the boundary layer () (f)

SWAMTH.definition: Shortwave radiation absorption method. Valid methods: 'top-layer', 'jerlov', 'chlorophyll' (a)

JWTYPE.definition: Number indicating the Jerlov (1968) water type (i)

CCFILE.definition: Name of file containing chlorophyll concentration climatology (a)

TRXDAY.definition: e-folding time scale (days) for SST relax., if 0 no relax. (f)

SRXDAY.definition: e-folding time scale (days) for SSS relax., if 0 no relax. (f)

TRXDPT.definition: Maximum mixed layer depth for e-folding SST relaxation (m) (f)

SRXDPT.definition: Maximum mixed layer depth for e-folding SSS relaxation (m) (f)

TRXLIM.definition: Max. absolute value of SST difference in relaxation (degC) (f)

SRXLIM.definition: Max. absolute value of SSS difference in relaxation (psu) (f)

SCFILE.definition: Name of file containing SSS climatology used for relaxation (a)

SPRFAC.definition: Send precipitation/runoff factor to CESM coupler (l)

ATM_PATH.definition: Path to forcing fields in case of EXPCNF 'ben02clim' or 'ben02syn' (a)

RSTFMT.definition: Format of restart file (valid arguments are 0 for classic, 1 for 64-bit offset and 2 for netcdf4/hdf5 format) (i)

CWMTAG.definition: Array of geographical names of channels to be modified (a)

CWMEDG.definition: Array of C grid cell edges to be modified. Valid options: 'u' or 'v' (a)

CWMWTH.definition: Array of modified grid cell widths (m) (f)

MER_ORFILE.definition: Name of file containing ocean region specification (a)

MER_MIFILE.definition: Name of file containing zonal section specification for meridional transport computation (a)

MER_REGNAM.definition: Array of region names for meridional overturning and flux diagnostics (a)

MER_REGFLG.definition: Array of mask flags in ocean regions file to be included for each region (i)

MER_MINLAT.definition: Minimum latitude to be considered for each region (f)

MER_MAXLAT.definition: Maximum latitude to be considered for each region (f)

SEC_SIFILE.definition: Name of file containing section specification for section transport computation (a)

SIG0.definition: sigma_2 at the sea surface [kg m-3] (f)

SIG0DZ.definition: minimum sigma_2 increment in depth [kg m-3] (f)

SIGDZ.definition: sigma_2 increments in depth that scale the tanh profile [kg m-3] (f)

SIGSCL.definition: sigma_2 scaling factor, larger number will make the stratification more surface intensified (f)

RDEPTH.definition: amplitude of the random noice added to the bottom depth [m] (f)

ACORRU.definition: amplitude of corrugations on the slopes given as displacement of the slope midpoint - set to 0 for no corrugations [cm] (f)

WLCORRU.definition: Along channel wave-length of corrugations on the slopes [cm] (f)

CWIDTH.definition: width of the slope region in [cm] (f)

SWIDTH.definition: slope mid-point distance from the domain N/S edge in [cm] (f)

SCXY.definition: grid cell (will be rectangular) dimensions in [cm] (f)

GLB_FNAMETAG.definition: Name tag for the averaging period

GLB_AVEPERIO.definition: Averaging period corresponding to the tags in days

GLB_FILEFREQ.definition: how often to start a new file in days (i)

GLB_NCFORMAT.definition: netcdf format (valid arguments are 0 for classic, 1 for 64-bit offset and 2 for netcdf4/hdf5 format)

H2D_DFL.definition: non-solar heat flux derivative [W m-2 K-1]

H2D_FMLTFZ.definition: fresh water flux due to melting/freezing [kg m-2 s-1]

H2D_HMLTFZ.definition: heat flux due to melting/freezing [W m-2]

H2D_IDKEDT.definition: mixed layer inertial kinetic energy tendency [kg s-3]

H2D_MLTSMN.definition: minimum mixed layer thickness using 'sigma-t' criterion [m]

H2D_MLTSMX.definition: maximum mixed layer thickness using 'sigma-t' criterion [m]

H2D_MLTSSQ.definition: mixed layer thickness squared using 'sigma-t' criterion [m2]

H2D_MTKEUS.definition: mixed layer TKE tendency related to friction velocity [kg s-3]

H2D_MTKENI.definition: mixed layer TKE tendency related to near inertial mot. [kg s-3]

H2D_MTKEBF.definition: mixed layer TKE tendency related to buoyancy forcing [kg s-3]

H2D_MTKERS.definition: mixed layer TKE tendency related to eddy restrat. [kg s-3]

H2D_MTKEPE.definition: mixed layer TKE tendency related to pot. energy change [kg s-3]

H2D_MTKEKE.definition: mixed layer TKE tendency related to kin. energy change [kg s-3]

H2D_SALFLX.definition: salt flux received by ocean [kg m-2 s-1]

H2D_SALRLX.definition: restoring salt flux received by ocean [kg m-2 s-1]

H2D_SURFLX.definition: heat flux received by ocean [W m-2]

H2D_SURRLX.definition: restoring heat flux received by ocean [W m-2]

H2D_TAUX.definition: momentum flux received by ocean x-component [N m-2]

H2D_TAUY.definition: momentum flux received by ocean y-component [N m-2]

LYR_UMFLTD.definition: mass flux due to thickness diffusion in x-direction [kg s-1]

LYR_UTFLTD.definition: heat flux due to thickness diffusion in x-direction [W]

LYR_UTFLLD.definition: heat flux due to lateral diffusion in x-direction [W]

LYR_USFLTD.definition: salt flux due to thickness diffusion in x-direction [kg s-1]

LYR_USFLLD.definition: salt flux due to lateral diffusion in x-direction [kg s-1]

LYR_VMFLTD.definition: mass flux due to thickness diffusion in y-direction [kg s-1]

LYR_VTFLTD.definition: heat flux due to thickness diffusion in y-direction [W]

LYR_VTFLLD.definition: heat flux due to lateral diffusion in y-direction [W]

LYR_VSFLTD.definition: salt flux due to thickness diffusion in y-direction [kg s-1]

LYR_VSFLLD.definition: salt flux due to lateral diffusion in y-direction [kg s-1]

LVL_UMFLTD.definition: mass flux due to thickness diffusion in x-direction [kg s-1]

LVL_UTFLTD.definition: heat flux due to thickness diffusion in x-direction [W]

LVL_UTFLLD.definition: heat flux due to lateral diffusion in x-direction [W]

LVL_USFLTD.definition: salt flux due to thickness diffusion in x-direction [kg s-1]

LVL_USFLLD.definition: salt flux due to lateral diffusion in x-direction [kg s-1]

LVL_VMFLTD.definition: mass flux due to thickness diffusion in y-direction [kg s-1]

LVL_VTFLTD.definition: heat flux due to thickness diffusion in y-direction [W]

LVL_VTFLLD.definition: heat flux due to lateral diffusion in y-direction [W]

LVL_VSFLTD.definition: salt flux due to thickness diffusion in y-direction [kg s-1]

LVL_VSFLLD.definition: salt flux due to lateral diffusion in y-direction [kg s-1]

MSC_MMFLXL.definition: meridional overturning circ. (MOC) on isopycnic layers [kg s-1]

MSC_MMFTDL.definition: MOC due to thickness diffusion on isopycnic layers [kg s-1]

MSC_MMFTDD.definition: MOC due to thickness diffusion on z-levels [kg s-1]

MSC_MHFTD.definition: meridional heat flux due to thickness diffusion [W]

MSC_MHFLD.definition: meridional heat flux due to lateral diffusion [W]

MSC_MSFTD.definition: meridional salt flux due to thickness diffusion [kg s-1]

MSC_MSFLD.definition: meridional salt flux due to lateral diffusion [kg s-1]

MSC_SSSGA.definition: global average sea surface salinity [g kg-1]
